fields.name: PREAMBLE
fields.description: Component ID bits [7:0]

fields.name: PREAMBLE
fields.description: Component ID bits [11:8]

fields.name: CLASS
fields.description: Component ID bits [15:12] - component class

fields.name: PREAMBLE
fields.description: Component ID bits [23:16]

fields.name: PREAMBLE
fields.description: Component ID bits [31:24]

fields.name: DBG_STOP
fields.description: Allows debug in Stop mode Write access can be protected by PWR_SECCFGR.LPMSEC. The CPU debug and clocks remain active and the HSI oscillators is used as system clock during Stop debug mode, allowing CPU debug capability. On exit from Stop mode, the clock settings are set to the Stop mode exit state.

fields.name: DBG_STANDBY
fields.description: Allows debug in Standby mode Write access can be protected by PWR_SECCFGR.LPMSEC. The CPU debug and clocks remain active and the HSI oscillator is used as system clock, the supply and SRAM memory content is maintained during Standby debug mode, allowing CPU debug capability. On exit from Standby mode, a standby reset is performed.

fields.name: LPMS
fields.description: Device low power mode selected 10x: Standby mode others reserved

fields.name: STOPF
fields.description: Device Stop flag

fields.name: SBF
fields.description: Device Standby flag

fields.name: CS
fields.description: CPU Sleep

fields.name: CDS
fields.description: CPU DeepSleep

fields.name: AUTH_ID
fields.description: Device specific ID Device specific ID used for RDP regression.

fields.name: AUTH_KEY
fields.description: Device authentication key The device specific 64-bit authentication key (OEMn key) must be written to this register (in two successive 32-bit writes, least significant word first) to permit RDP regression. Writing a wrong key locks access to the device and prevent code execution from the Flash memory.

fields.name: AP_PRESENT
fields.description: Bit n identifies whether access port APn is present in device  Bit n�=�0: APn absent  Bit n�=�1: APn present

fields.name: AP_ENABLED
fields.description: Bit n identifies whether access port APn is open (can be accessed via the debug port) or locked (debug access to the APn is blocked, except for access)  Bit n�=�0: APn locked (except for access to DBGMCU) Bit n�=�1: APn enabled
